Class MainFormController

java.lang.Object
controller.MainFormController
All Implemented Interfaces:
javafx.fxml.Initializable
public class MainFormController extends Object implements javafx.fxml.Initializable
This class creates the MainFormController.

      public MainFormController()

  • Method Details

    • onActionAddPart

      public void onActionAddPart(javafx.event.ActionEvent event) throws IOException
      This method will set up our AddPart scene after the respective event is fired.
      Parameters:
      event - event linked to add button under Parts TableView
      Throws:
      IOException - IOException

    • onActionModifyPart

      public void onActionModifyPart(javafx.event.ActionEvent event) throws IOException
      This method will set up our ModifyPart scene after the respective event is fired. We will also initialize a selectedPart on the highlighted/selected item of the Parts model, so it will take us to that exact menu to modify said part, also set up an if statement that says if the selectedPart is null, notify user that they did not select a part.
      Parameters:
      event - event linked to modify button under Parts TableView
      Throws:
      IOException - IOException

    • onActionDeletePart

      public void onActionDeletePart()
      This method will delete and remove a selectedPart from the Inventory. Here we create an object selectedPart of the Part class that will be taken from the Part model in the respective and highlighted area, we then delete the selectedPart from the Inventory, like the method above, set up an if statement to warn the user if they did not select a part.

    • onActionAddProduct

      public void onActionAddProduct(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent) throws IOException
      This method will delete and remove a selectedPart from the Inventory. Here we create an object selectedPart of the Part class that will be taken from the Part model in the respective and highlighted area, we then delete the selectedPart from the Inventory.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - this event is linked to the delete button under the Parts TableView
      Throws:
      IOException - IOException

    • onActionModifyProduct

      public void onActionModifyProduct(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent) throws IOException
      This method will retrieve the selectedProduct on the productsTableView and take us to the ModifyProductForm. Here we create an object selectedProduct of the Product class that will be taken from the Product model in the respective and highlighted area, we then load a new scene in which we will be sent to the ModifyProductForm with its data.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - this event is linked to the modify button under the Products TableView
      Throws:
      IOException - IOException

    • onActionDeleteProduct

      public void onActionDeleteProduct()
      This method will delete and remove a selectedProduct from the Inventory. Here we create an object selectedProduct of the Product class that will be taken from the Product model in the respective and highlighted area, we then delete the selectedProduct from the Inventory, we also display a respective error message indicating to the user that they need to remove associated parts from a product before deleting.

    • searchFieldPart

      public void searchFieldPart()
      This method will filter and search for a specific part related to user input. Here we create an object selectedProduct of the Product class that will be taken from the Product model in the respective and highlighted area, we then delete the selectedProduct from the Inventory.

    • searchFieldProduct

      public void searchFieldProduct()
      This method will filter and search for a specific product related to user input. Here we create an object selectedProduct of the Product class that will be taken from the Product model in the respective and highlighted area, we then delete the selectedProduct from the Inventory.

    • onActionExitApplication

      public void onActionExitApplication()
      This method will exit the application upon clicking the exit button.

    • initialize

      public void initialize(URL url, ResourceBundle resourceBundle)
      This method initializes the resourceBundle. Within this method we set up the respective parts and products table views so that they are able to take in the respective objects of Part and Product as well as all of their properties that we want to show the user.
      Specified by:
      initialize in interface javafx.fxml.Initializable
      Parameters:
      url - url
      resourceBundle - resourceBundle
